name: unrepressed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
expressing your feelings freely, especially feelings that some people are embarrassed or ashamed to show: I was shocked at how outgoing, adventurous, and totally unrepressed the people were. Children delight in the unrepressed and disgusting behaviour of others.
(of feelings, thoughts, and qualities) expressed freely, without embarrassment or shame: He shouted out in unrepressed joy. This figure is a blatant representation of unrepressed sexuality. Compare
repressed
More examplesFewer examplesShe was quickly learning that he was a verbally unrepressed person. The anti-hero is the unrepressed side of humanity, the savage within us that we like to keep under wraps.Reality becomes tainted with unrepressed subconscious thoughts.
